intro: Torilis sintenisii, commonly known as the slender sandparsley, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic leaves and umbel-shaped inflorescences. The plant typically features slender, branched stems and finely divided, fern-like leaves. Its small white flowers appear in late spring, and it produces small, dry fruits known as schizocarps. Torilis sintenisii is adapted to sandy soils and is often found in steppe and desert environments.
